intro: Pygeum dolichobotrys, commonly known as the long-stalked African privet, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Oleaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
